p: Molecular epidemiological studies have shown that the ancestral lineage of yellow fever virus (YFV) originated in Africa between 2000 and 4000 years ago. On the other hand the South American YFV separated from the African YFV approximately 200â€“400 years ago. These data support the original concept that indicates that the YFV arrived in the Americas during the period of slave trade ( Gould et al., 2003, Bryant et al., 2007, Moureau et al., 2015).
